name: Lormetazepam
summary: A short-acting benzodiazepine hypnotic used primarily for the short-term treatment of insomnia.
description: Lormetazepam is a benzodiazepine with strong hypnotic and sedative effects, indicated for short-term management of severe insomnia. It has a relatively rapid onset of action and an intermediate half-life, making it effective for sleep initiation and maintenance without excessive next-day sedation in most patients.

sections.text: Enhances the activity of GABA at the GABA-A receptor, increasing chloride influx and neuronal hyperpolarization, resulting in sedation and hypnosis.

adult.insomnia: 0.5–2 mg at bedtime; use the lowest effective dose

sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; lower doses recommended
sections.renal_impairment: Use with caution in severe impairment

sections.black_box: Concomitant use with opioids can cause profound sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death.
other: Risk of misuse, abuse, and dependence
Avoid abrupt discontinuation after prolonged use

sections.pregnancy: Avoid unless absolutely necessary; risk of fetal harm and neonatal withdrawal
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infants
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; start with lowest dose

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as rebound insomnia, anxiety, and tremors.

items: Short half-life reduces next-day sedation risk compared to longer-acting benzodiazepines
Best reserved for severe insomnia not responsive to non-pharmacologic interventions
High potential for dependence; avoid long-term use
